Entity: U.S. Department of Health and Human Services
Description: Get the prescriptions you need through the Emergency Prescription Assistance Program.

Apply by March 31, 2025, for FEMA disaster assistance to get 14 days to several months of temporary housing support. This can include rental assistance and hotel or other short-term lodging reimbursement.
Other_Notes:
Problem: This description seems to be inaccurate — the linked Docusign application says you'll need to print out the completed form and take it to a notary for a wet signature, so this doesn't seem to be a fully online process. This is also a duplicate of row 24, ID 57, because that result links to a central page with the English and Spanish versions of this Docusign form.

Suggestion: Remove this result.

Description: Apply by March 31, 2025 for FEMA disaster assistance. Get help with losses not covered by insurance — including temporary housing, repairs, and rebuilding.
Other_Notes:
Problem: This description seems to be inaccurate — the linked Docusign application says you'll need to print out the completed form and take it to a notary for a wet signature. This is also a duplicate of row 24, ID 57, because that result links to a page with the English and Spanish versions of this Docusign form.

Description: Apply by March 31, 2025, for a loan to repair physical damage to your business. Businesses of any size can apply. Apply by October 25, 2025, for a loan to cover economic losses to your small business.

Service_name: Business use tax or fee extension and relief
Entity: California Department of Tax and Fee Administration
Description: Get relief from penalties, collection costs, and interest. You can also get up to a 3-month filing extension on your tax returns.
Learn about the extended deadline to file and pay business income tax in Los Angeles County. The new deadline is October 15, 2025.

Service_name: Employer payroll tax and reporting extension
Description: Get an extension of up to two months to file state payroll reports and deposit state payroll taxes, without penalty or interest.
Mail:
Employment Development Department
PO Box 826880
Sacramento, CA 94280-0001

Entity: California Office of the Small Business Advocate
Description: Find resources and support for businesses and workers impacted by the wildfires. This includes financial help, recovery programs, and workforce support.
If you lost your job, apply for unemployment benefits.
If you are sick or injured from the fires, apply for disability benefits.
If you need time off work to care for your family, apply for Paid Family Leave.
Find job search tools like CalJOBS and other resources to help you find employment.
General support, referrals, and training to find a new job in California.
Apply for a new job on CalJOBS, California’s online job exchange system.

Service_name: WIC food benefits for women and children
Description: Get monthly benefits from the California Women, Infants and Children (WIC) program. Use these benefits to buy food for yourself and your children. You can also get nutrition and breastfeeding support.
CalFresh can help your family get access to healthy food. You can use monthly CalFresh benefits at most grocery stores and even farmers markets.
Other_Notes: Phone number is Fire specific and according to website only way to apply for benefits as part of the disaster declaration.

Description: Find locations near you where you can get free food and groceries.
Find resources and tips to take care of your mental health after a wildfire.
Other_Notes:
Problem: This is a duplicate of row 12, ID 23, FEMA disaster assistance. It goes to a different URL, but it's about the same benefit.

Suggestion: Remove this result.

Entity: California Department of Financial Protection & Innovation
Description: Get mortgage relief for structures damaged or destroyed by the LA fires. Temporarily reduce or pause mortgage payments, waive late fees, and more.

If you've already received the maximum amount of FEMA disaster assistance, you may be eligible for a grant from California's State Supplemental Grant Program (SSGP). FEMA will automatically apply on your behalf. You don't need to apply directly for these state disaster grants.

Entity: California Department of Food and Agriculture
Description: Get help if you lost a pet, had to leave a pet behind, or need shelter for your pet.
Other_Notes:
Problem: This isn't a resource for individuals or business owners who survived the wildfire — it's a resource for employees working in wildfire cleanup and debris removal. So it doesn't seem to fit the stated audiences of this tool.

Suggestion:
- If the finder tool wants to offer resources for employees working in cleanup, add categories and logic to support that user group.
- If the finder tool doesn't want to intentionally support employees working in cleanup as a user group, remove this result and consider finding a better place for this information on the /lafires webpages.
- If we actually intended this information to speak to residents who are cleaning up their own homes, rephrase the description to make it clear how individual residents should use this information (since much of it talks about employer responsibilities to their employees).

Description: Find information and guides to disaster assistance for immigrant Californians. Available in Spanish, simplified Chinese, traditional Chinese, and Armenian.
Find tips and resources to help you with insurance claims and issues.
Learn about the state law that prevents insurance companies from canceling or not renewing home insurance policies for one year after a wildfire. And find out if your zip code is protected.
Get help filing an insurance claim or resolving an issue with a claim you already filed.
Replace California driver's licenses or IDs. Fees are waived for licenses or IDs lost in the fires.
Replace titles for vehicles registered in California. Fees are waived for titles lost in the fires.

Entity: California Department of Housing and Community Development
Description: Replace manufactured and mobile home registration and titling documents. Fees may be waived for documents lost in the fires.

Service_name: Personal income tax documents and info
Description: Replace personal tax documents. File critical changes of information such as change of address and power of attorney.
Other_Notes: Can't find actual details about this.

Description: Learn how to replace service records (DD 214), awards, and medals.
Other_Notes: Can't find actual details about this.

Description: Unlicensed contractors often prey on survivors of disasters. To protect yourself, find a licensed contractor near you.
Verify a professional contractor's license. Each record lists a license status as expired, suspended, or revoked.
Other_Notes: Unable to locate a good information landing page.

Description: Work with a case manager from Catholic Charities of California who can guide you through the recovery process.
Other_Notes:
Problem: This FAQ page is linked from the URL in rwo 57 ID 65, and just provides more info about the tax extension described in that result. So this is a duplicate.

Suggestion: Remove this result.

Description: If you have CalVet home insurance, learn how to file a claim.
Find CalVet information and resources for veterans and their families affected by the Los Angeles wildfires.
Learn about the extended deadline to file and pay income tax in Los Angeles County. The new deadline is October 15, 2025.

Learn about the extended deadline to file and pay property taxes. The state property tax deadline is also extended. The new deadline is April 10, 2026. For those impacted by the LA fires, Governor Newsom has suspended penalties and interest on late property tax payments.
Get property tax relief if your home was damaged or destroyed.
Here’s what you need to know before you return to your home.

Entity: South Coast Air Quality Monitoring District
Description: Check your air quality through the South Coast Air Quality Monitoring District.
Other_Notes:
Problem: If a user is navigating the tool with the Spanish language toggle on, this result shows the service name and description in Spanish twice in a row. This is very confusing. This result is also really a duplicate of row 15, ID 46.

Suggestion: Remove this result.

Description: Replace Disabled Person Parking Placard.
Replace license plates and registration stickers.
File a change of address.
Replace vehicle or driver's records.
Learn about disaster relief protections to help with your energy, natural gas, water, landline, and mobile phone bills.
Contact crisis hotlines to get immediate mental health support.
Other_Notes:
Problem: This Info_link URL does not go to a Spanish version of the page. It goes to the same English version of the page in row 24, ID 57. So this is a duplicate and also inaccurate.

When I select "En espagnol" at the top of the linked English page, it directs to a completely different, more general Spanish page on the CDPH site: https://www.cdph.ca.gov/Programs/OPA/Pages/CDPHespanol.aspx And when I navigate from there, the site toggles back to English. So there doesn't appear to be a direct way to link to a Spanish version of this page.

Suggestion: Remove this result.

Description: New online service to get a certified copy of a birth record. This process is free for people affected by the LA fires. Must use a notary.
New online service to get a certified copy of a death record. This process is free for people affected by the LA fires. Must use a notary.
New online service to get a certified copy of a marriage record. This process is free for people affected by the LA fires. Must use a notary.

Service_name: Replace birth, death, and marriage records
Description: Replacements are free if you lost these vital records in the fires. Must visit a notary. Includes English and Spanish forms.

Entity: California Health and Human Services Agency
Description: Find digital mental health programs and support for youth, young adults, and families.

Service_name: Safety information for fire cleanup workers
Description: If you work in fire cleanup or debris removal, learn about safety gear and employee protections.
See the major steps to take when rebuilding your home. This includes insurance claims, permits, and more.
Opt in by March 31, 2025, to get free government debris removal. If you don't opt in, you'll need to pay for a private debris removal contractor instead.
Apply by March 12, 2025, for cash assistance grants for small businesses and nonprofits.

Service_name: Disaster loans for homeowners and renters
Description: Apply by March 31, 2025, for a loan to repair your home or replace personal property damaged in the fires.

Service_name: Worker Safety Wildfire Cleanup and Rebuilding
Description: The work to cleanup and rebuild after wildfires must comply with California's labor laws and workplace safety and health regulations. Learn about these requirements.
During debris removal, the USACE will remove trees that are hazardous. But you can request that a tree not be removed.
